before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2m0s2","text":"Prepare NGM agar and seed plates with BW25113 background strain for worm maintenance","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

29207.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fm6uj","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"817ee","text":"LB Broth contents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k94l","text":"4 g NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"234vn","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bf8pp","text":"2 g Yeast Extract","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvoqg","text":"dH2O to 400 mL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mtd7","text":"Add liquid LB to a tube or flask and add the appropriate antibiotic (if required) to the correct concentration (see table below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43opf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1cur","text":"Antibiotic Concentrations","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ft1j","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqaa7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ormh","text":"Note: If you intend to do a mini-prep you will usually want to start 2 mL in a falcon tube, but for larger preps you might want to use as much as a litre of LB in a 2 L Erlenmeyer flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colWidths":[50,50],"data":[["   \u003cb\u003eCommonly Used Antibiotics\u003c/b\u003e   ","   \u003cb\u003eRecommended Concentration\u003c/b\u003e   "],["  Ampicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Bleocin  ","  5 µg/mL  "],["  Carbenicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Chloramphenicol  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Coumermycin  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Gentamycin  ","  10 µg/mL  "],["  Kanamycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Spectinomycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Tetracycline  ","  10 µg/mL  "]],"guid":"D0D30710F76111E9A71C91C23E5C71A8","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"21mge","text":"Antibiotic concentrations","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qml6","text":"Using a sterile inoculation loop, select a single colony from your bacteria streaked LB agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36b3c","text":"Dip the inoculation loop into the liquid LB and swirl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v4vj","text":"Discard the inoculation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets20","text":"Loosely cover the culture with sterile aluminium foil or a cap that is not air tight as bacteria needs air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fs0c","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) in a shaking incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qs89","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lfjb","text":"Measure the optical density of the bacterial culture at 600nm wavelength using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pct0","text":"Record the OD600 three times and calculate average, use LB Broth as Blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47333.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"309bv","text":" Book the autoclave (notebook on top of the machine).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jj73","text":" Take clean flasks from the glass kitchen.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1djq8","text":" Measure all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the flask (Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Also, the cholesterol is kept in the fridge.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du0k","text":" Once water is added mix thoroughly and label with autoclave tape (‘NGM Rm 5009’). Make sure the bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1upm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n4ll","text":"     - Turn ON the autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hcii","text":"     - Make sure that the autoclave’s probe bottle is the same size as the largest bottle you use and fill it with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6m9aj","text":"     - Place the temperature probe in it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64o03","text":"     - Fill up the autoclave with water until it reaches the grill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e2tak","text":"     - Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"15kuc","text":"     - Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f30mb","text":"     - Use ‘media’ program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3da1n","text":"     - Press START.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b3ll","text":"     - It will take about 2 hours for a 500ml bottle to autoclave and about 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3or95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do41r","text":" When autoclave is complete, remove the probe flask ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9f79r","text":" Make sure to wear gloves as the flask will be hot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fe27u","text":" Let the agar to cool to around 55°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rb6n","text":" Add the post autoclave reagents.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3iou4","text":" Mix it well and start pouring onto imaging plates following the Protocol for Plate Pouring.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qt0f","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v7q2","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

47335.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1usv2","text":"Leave the Falcon tube to stand for a while until the worm settle to the bottom in a loose pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2av71","text":"Add 350μL bleach mix to the 2mL solution of worms in M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jfp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qmhk","text":"Wash worms off the plates with a few mL of M9 buffer into a 15mL Falcon tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7mps2","text":"Mix together in an Eppendorf tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3cn9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ep24","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fj5uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"0DDD5530709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"NaOH [4M]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"350","error":false,"guid":"1D01FB10709111EB96968141F1145020","id":0,"label":"Sodium Hypochlorite [Acros Organics, 10/15% active chlorine, 7681-52-9]","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5p10d","text":"Remove the supernatant leaving 2mL M9 solution in the tube (with the worms pelleted)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj7qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1ufj","text":"Vortex for 5 min (checking every 30 seconds under a microscope to see if the worms are broken apart and eggs have been released).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar6md","text":"Once the majority of eggs have been released, quench the solution by topping up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr54","text":"Centrifuge at 6700 rpm for 2 minutes to pellet the eggs to the bottom.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dcs42","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"124sm","text":"Top up the Falcon tube to 14mL with M9. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae79f","text":"Repeat Steps 8 - 10 three more times, to thoroughly quench the bleach solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fsnp","text":"After the final wash, top up to 10mL with M9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kauh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b51gg","text":"The next morning, transfer the newly hatched L1 larvae in 10mL M9 solution to a sterile conical Eppendorf tube using a glass Pasteur pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ohav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kf64","text":"Pipette the 10mL solution onto an empty 60mm plate using a glass Pasteur pipette, and incubate at 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c65h","text":"Using a glass Pasteur pipette, remove as much supernatant as possible, and then pool all L1 worms together into a single Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lpds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjfek","text":"Dispense 3μL of L1 solution on the lid of a 60mm Petri plate, and count under microscope how many worms are in the droplet. Use this to estimate the total worm concentration of the Eppendorf. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"obo6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21sm7","text":"Using a DISTRIMAN Gilson repetitive pipette, dispense approximately 500 worms onto each plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mchf","text":"NB: The concentration may be adjusted by re-centrifuging and removing less supernatant with the Pasteur pipette (to dilute the solution if needed), and re-counting the number of worms in 3μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5c2j1","text":"In order to test how quickly C. elegans responds to the bacterial lawn, individual worms are gently picked onto 35mm petri plates a short distance away from the seeded lawn, and recording started immediately. Are there any differences between behaviour on BW control vs BW25113ΔfepD after only a few seconds-to-minutes on food?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8015e","text":"The steps are not chronological. Please read the whole protocol before beginning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ansc","text":"30 x 35mm Petri plates (imaging plates)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11ob2","text":"3 x 60mm Petri plates (maintenance plates)\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e54fl","text":"For 1L NGM agar:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"893hu","text":"- 3g NaCl (ref: fisher 447300010 )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rmsr","text":"- 2.5g bactopeptone (ref: BD 21167 lot 8270639)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ad4i","text":"- 17g agar (ref : A7002-5KG lot BCBM1702V)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn4j4","text":"- 1L H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcoto","text":"- Salts (post-autoclave):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agsnt","text":"    25mL KH2PO4, pH=6.0 (ref : SIGMA P0662-2,5KG)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er37t","text":"    1mL MgSO4, 7H2O (1M) (ref : SIGMA M5921-500G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqhvn","text":"    1mL CaCl2 (1M) (ref : SIGMA C5080-500G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d10jf","text":"    1mL cholesterol (5mg/mL) (ref : SIGMA C8667-5G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q3vi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al34q","text":"For 1L LB broth:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnfnc","text":"- 25g LB powder (ref : fisher BP9723-500)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sq01","text":"- 1L H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e79c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ti6j","text":"For 1L M9:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qkr4","text":"- 3g KH2PO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g0uc","text":"- 7g Na2HPO4.2H2O (ref : SIGMA 71645-1KG )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkbet","text":"- 5g NaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nstc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0b7v","text":"50mg/mL Kanamycin (in water, filter 0.2mm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88lf0","text":"Make 500mL normal Nematode Growth Media (NGM) agar, following the protocol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cdn4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8pkas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":47333,"title":"Making normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eMaking normal NGM for imaging plates (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"making-normal-ngm-for-imaging-plates-cabreiro-lab-bsgdnbs6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":3},"type_id":1,"guid":"712F9AA0939811ECAC85972C6DEF1E13"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g830","text":"Pour 15mL agar into each of 3 x 60mm Petri plates ('maintenance' plates) and 3.5mL agar into each of 30 x 35mm Petri plates ('imaging' plates)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m76s","text":"Leave to cool under a hood, then store at 4°C until used for seeding lawns","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ejum","text":"Using an eyebrow hairpick, gently pick 15 - 20 L4-stage N2 Bristol C. elegans onto each maintenance plate, and store in an incubator at 20°C (Monday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":67,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhpnd","text":"After 24 hours, remove the adult worms, leaving the eggs behind to hatch into L1 larvae (Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4o6d","text":"Bleach-synchronise the worms by performing an egg prep, following the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lsjv","text":"(Friday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgjgf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8esst","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":47335,"title":"Egg Prep   for Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eEgg Prep   for Bleach Synchronization (Cabreiro Lab)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"egg-prep-for-bleach-synchronization-cabreiro-lab-bsgfnbtn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":18},"type_id":1,"guid":"036C1940939C11ECAC85972C6DEF1E13"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"caajf","text":"At around noon the next day, wash L1 larvae off the empty plate with a few mL of M9 using a glass Pasteur pipette, and re-feed onto BW-seeded maintenance plates. Incubate at 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csi6c","text":"(Saturday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2161","text":"Prepare two Erlenmeyer flasks with 50mL LB for inoculating a liquid bacterial culture of BW control and BW25113ΔfepD bacteria. Add 50mg/mL Kanamycin to BW25113ΔfepD flask","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1doca","text":"(Friday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31pvu","text":"Inoculate from a single colony picked from streaked LB plates stored at 4°C, following the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9nv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dvbnn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":29207,"title":"Inoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eInoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"inoculating-a-liquid-bacterial-culture-8rxhv7n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":7},"type_id":1,"guid":"29BE6E90939C11ECAC85972C6DEF1E13"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9876i","text":"Leave overnight in a shaking incubator (37°C, 200rpm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"712jj","text":"The next day, remove the bacterial cultures from the shaking incubator, and prepare another two Erlenmeyer flasks each with 50mL LB, for inoculating a second round of overnight cultures. Only this time, do not add Kanamycin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g6ce","text":"(Saturday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duhjt","text":"Inoculate the second round of cultures by pipetting approximately 50μL bacterial culture from the first overnight culture. Leave in a shaking incubator overnight (37°C, 200rpm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49hh1","text":"The next day, remove the overnight cultures from the shaking incubator, and store at 4°C until seeding imaging plates the following day","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5p693","text":"(Sunday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dcf4","text":"Remove imaging plates from 4°C, and dry under a hood for 30 minutes to remove condensation. Remove the bacterial cultures from 4°C and leave on the bench for 30 minutes to acclimate to room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f82lr","text":"(Monday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9ca","text":"Pipette 30μL of bacterial culture onto the centre of each imaging plate, taking care not to damage the agar with the pipette tip. Seed half of the plates with BW control, and the other half with BW25113ΔfepD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"685qj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1alvs","text":"Leave the seeded plate to dry for 20 minutes under the hood, then transfer to a 25°C incubator and leave to grow for a further 7 hours and 40 minutes (for a total of 8 hours lawn growth time), before storing at 4°C for tracking the next day","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj7tt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eeamq","text":"On the day of tracking, remove the seeded plates from 4°C and dry under a hood for 30 minutes to remove condensation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo5nm","text":"(Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"k78o","text":"Prior to tracking, ensure that the imaging cave air conditioning is turned on (and there has not been a power-cut) and also empty the dehumidifier waste water tray (see pre-imaging checklist)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mbau","text":"(Tuesday)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6991d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"afp96","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"da25l","text":"Normal temperature range: 19 - 21°C","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bf8hs","text":"Humidity: 35 - 45%","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"facq4","text":"Remove the seeded imaging plates from 4°C and leave on bench top (with lids on) for 30 minutes to acclimate to room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aioj5","text":"Remove the plate of age-matched (Day1 adult) worms from 20°C incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dd99c","text":"Using an eyebrow hairpick, gently transfer a single worm onto an imaging plate, a short distance away from the food lawn","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12kvu","text":"Quickly transport the imaging plate to the imaging cave, place under the rig A1 position, and start the recording as soon as the worm approaches the edge of the food lawn","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7803","text":"Worm behaviour was tracked for a total of 30 minutes (25 fps), and a 10-second blue-light stimulus was delivered every 5 minutes as a stressor to encourage an aversive 'escape' response in the worms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Keio Acute Single-Worm Tracking
